alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 5:22PM CDT until August 23 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN COUNTY... At 422 PM MDT, Heavy rain has ended across northern Sheridan county. However runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is likely causing flooding across the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mount Maria and Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
